title: Injustice led to ban on Muslim vendors around temples: Vishwesha Teertha of Pejawar Math - Deccan Herald
content:
1. Injustice led to ban on Muslim vendors around temples: Vishwesha Teertha of Pejawar Math  Deccan Herald
  2. Karnataka CM says his govt will look into demand of banning 'halal' meat | Bengaluru News  Times of India
  3. Massive Showdown In Karnataka Over Halal, BJP's CT Ravi Calls Halal 'Economic Jihad'  India Today
  4. Dissenting voices in Karnataka BJP, Kerala Sangh Parivar could help open up spaces for difficult conversations  The Indian Express
  5. Ban on Muslim traders in Karnataka temples citing 2002 rule: Understanding what the law actually says  Firstpost
  6. View Full coverage on Google News
description: With Muslims vendors being prohibited from doing business on temple premises during Hindu religious festivals and fairs in parts of Karnataka, Vishwesha Teertha Swamiji of the renowned Pejawar Math on Wednesday said certain incidents of injustice with Hindus have led to this "explosive situation". He also said the solution should emerge from within the society and religious leaders voicing their opposition to the move is unlikely to help matters.
